Organism_Record.Function_Summary: Represses the synthesis of biosynthetic enzymes and activates the arginine catabolism. Controls the transcription of the two operons rocABC and rocDEF.

Funtion.Detail: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with 2-amino-5-(carbamimidamido)pentanoic acid.
Any molecular function by which a gene product interacts selectively with DNA (deoxyribonucleic acid).
Protein which interferes with transcription, usually by binding to specific sites on DNA. Also used for proteins which repress translation.

Interacting selectively and non-covalently with a specific DNA sequence in order to modulate transcription. The transcription factor may or may not also interact selectively with a protein or macromolecular complex.
Funtion.Keyword: Sequence-specific DNA binding transcription factor activity

BioProcess.Detail: The chemical reactions and pathways resulting in the formation of amino acids, organic acids containing one or more amino substituents.
The chemical reactions and pathways resulting in the formation of arginine, 2-amino-5-(carbamimidamido)pentanoic acid.
The cellular synthesis of either RNA on a template of DNA or DNA on a template of RNA.
The cellular synthesis of RNA on a template of DNA.
The chemical reactions and pathways involving arginine, 2-amino-5-(carbamimidamido)pentanoic acid.
Any process that modulates the frequency, rate or extent of the synthesis of either RNA on a template of DNA or DNA on a template of RNA.
The chemical reactions and pathways resulting in the breakdown of arginine into other compounds, including ornithine.

The process of creating protein oligomers, compounds composed of a small number, usually between three and ten, of component monomers; protein oligomers may be composed of different or identical monomers. Oligomers may be formed by the polymerization of a number of monomers or the depolymerization of a large protein polymer.

PDB.PDB_Title: Crystal structure of a dimer of N-terminal domains of AhrC in complex with an 18bp DNA operator site
PDB.PubMed_Title: Structure and function of the arginine repressor-operator complex from Bacillus subtilis.

PDB.PDB_Title: C-terminal domain hexamer of AhrC bound with L-arginine

PDB.Author: Garnett, J.A., et al.

PDB.PDB_Title: Crystal structure of the N-terminal domain of AhrC
PDB.PubMed_Title: A high-resolution structure of the DNA-binding domain of AhrC, the arginine repressor/activator protein from Bacillus subtilis.
PDB.Author: Garnett, J.A., et al.

PDB.PDB_Title: CRYSTAL STRUCTURE OF AHRC, THE ARGININE REPRESSOR/ACTIVATOR PROTEIN FROM BACILLUS SUBTILIS
PDB.PubMed_Title: The structure of AhrC, the arginine repressor/activator protein from Bacillus subtilis.
PDB.Author: Dennis C, C.A., et al.
